metadata.Title: CVE-2018-16079 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A race condition between permission prompts and navigations in Prompts in Google Chrome prior to 69.0.3497.81 allowed a remote attacker to spoof the contents of the Omnibox (URL bar) via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16079` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 69.0.3497.81-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 69.0.3497.81-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 69.0.3497.81-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 69.0.3497.81-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 69.0.3497.81-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '69.0.3497.81-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
